utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh… no.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 'Cause I can't feel my legs.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Dr. Chase? Robert?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: I'm Walter Cofield. I'm a neurologist over at…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know who you are.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Good. Think you're up for answering a couple questions?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, it's not like I can get up and run away. Wasn't my best joke.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: I'm smiling because, for the last 12 hours, I've been picturing you with orange hair.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I dyed it back.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Were you angry with Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was a prank. It wasn't uncommon.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: So I've heard. That doesn't mean you couldn't get angry. Might actually contribute to that reaction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: May I ask why that matters? Are you trying to prove that I was distracted, that my judgment was compromised?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Who do you think was at fault for what happened to you, Dr. Chase?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Again, why does it matter?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: You're a smart doctor. You know what happened here better than anyone, and you've worked with Dr. House longer than anyone. And I suspect that you've spent every minute since this has happened trying to answer that very question.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't think it was anyone's fault. I was angry, but I wasn't distracted. And I think that, if there's any chance I'm gonna walk again, it's because Dr. House is a genius.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How about warmth? Can you feel the sheets on your skin?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I just said I don't feel anything. Objectivity, House. What about posttraumatic syringomyelia? Syrinx formed in the subarachnoid space, blocking the flow of cerebrospinal fluid.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That'd mean the damage was permanent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Forget the nerves.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, if it's total paralysis, he must have…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Think arteries. Blood flow to his spinal column is cut off. It's a clot in the radicular artery.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That could be fixable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prep a room for an embolectomy. Let's get that thing out of there before it does any more damage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And if it's not a clot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then you can ask Foreman if hospital insurance covers ramp-vans.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're through the aorta.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Sensory level is at L5. It must be the descending branch.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can I see the monitor?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Stop there. Shoot the dye.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There it is.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't get too excited. We still got to get it out. Still could have done permanent damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient does not have autonomic dysregulation. There's blood in his urine bag. Kidneys are failing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: House, not now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got to be now. Foreman is transferring our guy to Princeton general as soon as there's a bed available. Says the doctors here can no longer be objective since the stabbing.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: In the middle of a procedure that could basically save your life, House is actually trying to drag people away? How do you work with a guy like that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He wasn't trying to pull anybody away. Everyone had already refused to work on that case. He knew the answer. He wanted to check on me. But he needed an excuse. Otherwise, he could be accused of caring.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: So your testimony is that Dr. House's complete lack of concern is evidence of his deep concern? Did you just do that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Wiggle your toes.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Do you feel that? Congratulations. It was the clot. Short occlusion time of the artery, when the swelling goes down, you should… gain back at least some of the function. One more thing. Sorry. You knew that your patient was at risk for a psychotic break when you brought a scalpel within his reach. Why did you ignore that risk?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I thought I was right about the rash. I would do it again.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: I thought so.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What, that's it? "I thought so"? What the hell does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: You brazenly defied your boss. Now that happened either because Dr. House has established that that's okay in his world, or his prank war distracted you, or House makes medicine a game, and you just wanted to beat him. Whatever the reason, it boils down to the fact that you may never walk again because House created an atmosphere that promotes recklessness.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: This will be our last round of questions. I've spoken with Dr. Chase. You know he regained movement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Are you really this indifferent to the fact that Dr. Chase is hurt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're going off the record because this is irrelevant, or are you gonna hit me?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Why don't you go tell the guy you're sorry…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't do anything wrong.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: It's not an admission of guilt. He's your friend, and he's not well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's a coworker.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Coworker whom you've known for almost ten years who nearly died and who's still scared he may not walk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you going to have me fired for bad manners?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Just trying to understand you. Why a man in your position, with your abilities, is incapable of shaking the impulse to act like an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could we go back on the record and get this over with?

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Put the Vicodin away, Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My leg hurts.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Is that supposed to be funny?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two explosions.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: We're not done here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, hold on.

utterance.speaker: EMT 1
utterance.content: Close it up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take him out of there.

utterance.speaker: EMT 1
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman said you'd try this. Said to tell you he's no longer your patient.

utterance.speaker: EMT 2
utterance.content: Let's go!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait. Wait.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I have to get to my car. I don’t… I n—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your husband has a tumor in his lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You've been wrong every time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, well, not this time. The explosion in the classroom caused the cancer cells to break open. It's called tumor lysis syndrome. His body's flooded with an excess of phosphates, potassium, acids, all kinds of cancerous junk. It explains the paralysis, the bleeding, the heart and kidney issues, everything.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: What about the psychotic break?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Turns out we caused that. This is treatable. Okay? You have to tell the new doctors that he needs total body radiation and plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Move your cane, please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's Cofield?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He said you walked out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm walking back. I'm not done testifying.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Apparently you were. Said he'd have his decision tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: This case is a fiasco. Didn't sleep last night. Dr. House is obviously brilliant…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I think we've heard enough.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: But Dr. House is also a fiasco. If I were to exonerate him, condone his completely reckless, immature, almost misanthropic behavior, I would essentially be sending a message to all the other doctors in this hospital that it's okay to act that way and… it… is—

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: We're in the middle of something.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I know. I came to speak with Dr. House. And when they told me he was in here, I thought I should say something. I mean… he wasn't the nicest doctor I've ever met.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I think we've heard enough.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: But he was right. They found the tumor. They are removing it, and they are starting plasmapheresis. They expect a full recovery. He saved my husband's life. Well… I guess that's it. Thanks again.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: As I was saying, Dr. House's process is dangerous, inappropriate. But he is effective. I've decided that I would be doing this hospital a disservice if I did anything to change that process. Congratulations, Dr. House. This unfortunate stabbing incident is officially nobody's fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Coward.

utterance.speaker: Cofield
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've got, like, 20 pages of notes there. You were expecting to bore us for at least half an hour. You got my parole form in here. You were gonna send me back to prison.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, stop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good things usually happen; Bad things sometimes happen. The fact that that would-be widow came in just in time to sob all over your soft, mushy heart and the fact that her husband's gonna live does not change whether or not I did the right thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How'd you get the firing wire into the Vicodin bottle without me noticing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why'd I even have to? What was the point of the orange hair?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your hair smelled like Adams. And since there's no way that you're doing her without me knowing, it means you were just doing her shampoo. Which means you were out late drinking with some new girl or, because there is no new girl, you were trying to make up time by showering at the hospital because you're too lazy to buy your own shampoo. So I found a way to let you know to not be late.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You couldn't just ask me to stop being late?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What fun would that be?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: None of this is fun, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They decided that your being stabbed… was nobody's fault. They're wrong. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Anything else? I'm kind of busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. That was it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I've got it.
